body.p: When you log in to the administration interface, you start with the Dashboard page. This page is especially helpful for those who want to integrate the Feedback commenting component in multiple websites. It aggregates basic information about all the existing site configurations that has the current user assigned as Owner, Admin, or Moderator.

This page is divided into two panes. The left pane (Sites) displays all the existing site configurations along with information such as the Owner. The site configurations with pending comments are listed first, and then the rest are sorted alphabetically. The right pane (Activity Stream) displays all the activity for the site configurations including information about the person who made the change and details about each activity. There are also several components in each pane that help you to filter the information or navigate to a certain page:
Both panes have a filter drop-down menu at the top-right corner. If you do not want to see the information for all site configurations, you can choose to filter it by the site configurations that you are assigned as the Owner, Admin, or Moderator.
In the left pane, there is a widget to the right of the filter drop-down menu. Clicking this widget opens the Sites page where all the site configurations are displayed in a tile format.
In the left pane, if you click on the name of the site configuration, it will open the Comments page where comments can be moderated and managed for the particular configuration.
In the left pane, if you hover over the colored bar to the right of the site configuration name, it will display the number of comments for that site by status type.
In the left pane, you can see the number of community members for each site configuration to the right of the colored bar. If you click this number, it will open the Community management page where you can see all the management team members for the site configuration as well as all the user who have posted a comment on the website where the commenting system is installed.
In the right pane, if you click on the name of the page (or the navigation widget to the far right side), it will open the particular webpage where the comment exists.
In the right pane, if you click on the name of the site configuration (or the version number), it will open the Comments page where comments can be moderated and managed for the particular configuration.

p.note: No matter what page you are on within the administration interface, clicking on the Oxygen Feedback logo at the top-left corner will navigate back to the main Sites page.
